fields.name: Chilango
fields.description:
1. Chicken - without the cheese, damn good! Get it with peppers, onions, both mild and spicy sauces to give it a real kick,and black beans. Meat is nicely flavoured, making it the best in the Shoreditch area by far.
2. Prawn - very nice flavour, and all the same options as the chicken.
3. This Isn't Chicken - a testament to this place that even the vegan option would put Chilango top (cheese excluded, of course).
4. Steak - good but chunky.
5. Pork Belly - nice, but too salty

Notes: Best without the cheese. Fries are good

fields.name: Daddy Donkey's Mexican Grill
fields.description:
1. Chicken burrito - great flavour, and I loved the number of spice options (particularly with smoky chipotle as the second spiciest). Best variant is the 'Kick-Ass', which comes with with black beans, peppers and onions. 
2. Shredded Beef - not quite as good.

Notes: Guacamole and lime rice are good. Overall this burrito is up there with the best. No sides worth noting.

fields.name: Nanna Mexico
fields.description:
Ah Nanna Mex, it wouldn't have been uni have been without it. Enjoys a well-deserved monopoly on the Cambridge burrito scene.

1. Chicken Tinga - good spice, quantity, and nice chorizo flavour throughout. Nice choice of beans, peppers, salsa, and even a cheese sauce. Highly recommended. 
2. Pork Belly - pretty damn tasty if pork belly is your thing. Definitely worth trying
3. Beef - fine I suppose

Notes: fairly good guacamole. Costs extra but it still beats London prices.

fields.name: Tortilla
fields.description:
1. Chicken - Spicy, choice of beans, nicely flavoured meat, and good choices for onions, salsas, and other additional vegetables. All you could want from a good Californian-style burrito.
2. Pork Carnitas
3. Beef Barbacoa
Other notes: Good guac, and quesadillas aren't bad either.

fields.name: DF Tacos
fields.description:
1. Chicken - very limited customisation, but a good burrito. Pairs nicely with the restaurant's delicious cheesy chips and choice of spices (including the Chipotle ketchup).
2. Pulled Pork - Go for it if pulled meats are your thing.

Probably the best Mexican place in Shoreditch for an actual sit-down evening meal rather than a takeaway. It's the Nando's of burritos, but with frozen margaritas.

fields.name: Luardos (Whitecross)
fields.description: A street food van that can be hired for events as well. So popular that a fundraiser popped up to keep them afloat in Covid times. 1. Chicken - Pretty good! All the requirements of a good burrito. Not as filling as some other places, but the guacamole is incredible, and can add chorizo. Like Chilango, best with both mild and spicy sauces. 2. Pork - Pulled meats just don't seem to be my thing

fields.name: Casita Mexicana*
fields.description:
1. Chicken Fajitas - massive portion - two whole fajitas, super filling. Decent spice, peppers nice, came with guacamole and standard salsa + sour cream. Chicken was average. Worth it for the quantity though!
2. Chicken Burrito - nice cheesiness, crispy wrap, mildly good spice, hearty and warming like a pizza. However, kidney beans are not the best bean for a burrito, and are non-optional here.

Notes: They do amazing value loaded fries.
*also masquerades as Mexico Town, Dirty Finger, Mexican Taco, and Mexican Kitchen on Deliveroo

fields.name: Sonora Mexicana
fields.description:
1. Chicken Fajitas - Weird-tasting, though the grilled peppers taste good. The complimentary nachos are a nice touch, but there's just something a bit wrong with it that's hard to pinpoint.
2. Chicken Burrito - Actively bad. It's got some weird horrible flavour that should be nowhere near a burrito (cloves? cinnamon?). Also why is the guacamole runny? There's not enough tomato-ey redness to the burrito the thing is a weird white mess. They're lucky I weight rankings by the best item of the menu, in this case the fajitas, or they'd be down with Anejo (who I suspect they share a supplier with).

Note: The piri-salted chips are quite good.

fields.name: Taco Bell
fields.description:
In general, doesn't taste healthy, but is a nice indulgence, if a bit heavy on cream.
1. Crunchwrap Supreme - Unusual shape, but I'm counting it as a pseudo-burrito. Seasoned beef and grilled chicken are both  tasty, and it comes with a nice mix of tomato and lettuce to feel a little healthier (by Taco Bell standards). Pair with chips.
2. Spicy Chicken Griller - the shredded chicken wasn't bad, and the jalapenos helped give it some kick. Makes for a nice cheap snack-size add-on.
3. Volcano Burrito - It was fine, perhaps a bit heavy on the cream/cheese, but a bit small. Some nice flavour but overall not that special. Enjoyed the loaded fries more.
4. Crispy Chicken Burrito - Basically just a fried chicken wrap. Fire sauce helps give it some kick, but is a little vinegary.
5. 7-Layer Burrito - Ew, just no.

fields.name: BarBurrito
fields.description: 1. Chicken and Chorizo - Very good customization options for the fillings, and they do a decent job (good guacamole), but it was no more than the sum of its parts.

fields.name: Diner Shoreditch
fields.description:
1. Breakfast burrito - best breakfast burrito on here, particularly with some hash brown bites. Very eggy, had some salsa on it. Bit drippy, and slightly too much lime in the guac, but nice. Ate it while watching The Mandalorian
2. Chicken burrito -Pretty good, bit average. Some unusual veg choices, and no standout flavours. On the other hand, the hanger fries there were INCREDIBLE

fields.name: Pepe's
fields.description: 1. Chicken burrito - false advertising to call itself a burrito. It's spicy enough, but small and not particularly flavoursome. Don't bother

fields.name: Chipotle
fields.description: 1. Chicken burrito - A more recent order has upgraded this from my original review. The meat had a decent grilled (if tad salty) flavour reminiscent of chilango and tortilla, and it had the right level of spice. Enjoyed the guacamole, and the sour cream/cheese was creamy without being overdone. Thought they missed a trick doing something with the rice though, just offering plain as opposed to coriander lime or tomato, but at least they had options on the beans. On balance they deserve a top 10 place.

fields.name: Wraps and Wings
fields.description:
1. Chicken burrito - Now this was a weird one.  Mayonnaise is one of the dominant flavours, though not necessarily in a bad way. Somehow it also tastes...yellow? Some odd herby tinges but on the whole a pretty good burrito, with nice chips on the side. Would like more spice/veg options though.

Notes: Apparently it's an Indian chain. Explains why it didn't taste very Mexican for a burrito

fields.name: Mi casa
fields.description: 1. Chicken Burrito - ok. Chicken is unflavoured, but chilli is spicy and tastes alright. Have had some noticeably worse-tasting ones as they near closing time.

fields.name: Edu (Boxpark)
fields.description: 1. Chicken burrito - Not sure I consider it a standard burrito vendor - they offer one that has fried chicken in breadcrumbs, and the normal one seems to have sweetcorn, possibly even mayonnaise? Not spicy enough, and if you ask them to make it spicy they seem to just put more jalapenos in rather than using a good chilli salsa. Saying that, it's still quite edible and they have decent chips there.

fields.name: Wahaca
fields.description:
1. Chicken burrito - not bad, not great. Seemed creamier than I expected. Pretty mild spice, and not that flavourful. At least it was black beans. Maybe guacamole would have helped. Was small too. Expected better from such a well-known place.

Re-review: went back again, guacamole did help a bit but overall it was still unimpressive. Also, 4 days later tested positive for Coronavirus. -0.1 points for that and the poor track and trace system. Great tequila shots though.

fields.name: Mexis
fields.description: The new burrito place on the block turned out to be quite bland. Didn't stand out.

fields.name: Wrap It Up!
fields.description: 1. Mexican Meat Wrap - it was ok

fields.name: TAKO
fields.description:
1. Chicken Tinga - After seeing the reviews were solid these days, tried it again, and it was very edible. Perhaps they've changed the recipes, or the beef one had just been microwaved for an evening order, but I liked it. Tomato rice, good guac, some onion. Bit light on the spice (though it wasn't in a separate pot this time), and meat texture wasn't my favourite, but it was a relief just for it to not be like the previous order.
2. Barbacoa beef burrito - Spice came in a separate pot, and it tasted weird as hell (similar weird flavour to Anejo Mexicana). Recommended only if starving on a desert island, and maybe not even then.

fields.name: Pepitos
fields.description: 1. Chicken Tinga burrito - is it possible for a burrito to end up tasting like a tuna pasta bake? This appears to have been the mission their chefs had in mind. Got a nice bit of chorizo on first bite, but after that noticed that the texture was poor and the cheese was overdone. Don't bother.

fields.name: Anejo Mexicano
fields.description:
1. Chicken fajitas - honestly how do you make food this bad? Peppers redeem it infinitesimally above the burritos here, but that's no achievement
2. Chicken burrito - Vomit-worthy. Genuinely so bad I didn't finish it.

fields.name: Desperados
fields.description:
Another slightly funny one. Clearly a restaurant that's adapted to become a delivery-based place in these strange, uncertain, and of course unprecedented times.
1. Chicken fajitas - guacamole is perfect, meat is salty and grilled. It's a slightly annoying DIY job on the wraps, but once done the combo is delicious. Really nice mix of onion types too.
2. Chicken Burrito - when I first opened it I thought they got my order wrong - it was all deconstructed, with bean soup, sour cream, guacamole, and rice all separate from the actual burrito (which had cheese melted on top so required a knife and fork). Despite somehow seeming to have worse guac (too lemony) than came with fajitas of the same place, the meal was actually really nice. Not your traditional handheld job of course, but the spicy bean soup was really nice, and the rest of it complemented nicely. A refreshing change of pace to have one like a proper restaurant meal.

fields.name: Grillz on Wheelz
fields.description:
1. Chicken Burrito -  Not bad, similar to the chicken shawarma place next to it in a way. It's the kebab of burritos. Hot, tasted grilled, salty. Less Mexican than some, but decent.
2. Mixed burrito - something just makes me a bit uncomfortable about chicken, lamb, and beef all in the same burrito.

Note: as with any street grill stand, you do wonder how sanitary it is

fields.name: Bombay Burrito
fields.description: Should I be counting something so obviously not Mexcan? It's here for now, and very good at what it does, which is giving you a spicy customized curry with a great mix of flavours, in wrap form. Though perhaps if you want a jalfrezi you should just get a jalfrezi.

fields.name: Byburrito
fields.description:
For a place that stands for 'build your burrito', I expected more customisation options. It wasn't bad, and the place did do cheesy fries, but I wanted more from it. I think it's a Deliveroo own-brand attempt rather than its own thing. Still, I'd be interested to try their other offerings.
1. Pulled Chicken - somehow, it was so savoury it almost tasted like a cornish pasty, or as if it were full of gravy. Not that I don't like gravy, but was odd from a burrito.

fields.name: Garden Gangstas/Skinny Kitchen
fields.description: Mexi Burrito - vegan soy chilli mince with refried bean, charred corn and allsorts in. Good spice, nice onion flavours, some tomato, a hint of coriander on the guacamole. Really liked it. If I were to have any criticism it'd be that it was a tad heavy on the kidney beans, and wouldn't have minded some meatier texture, but it tasted great (and healthy) and was a good size too.

fields.name: Mestizo
fields.description: Chicken Mole Burrito - saw that the recipe included chocolate and was intrigued (also helped me pick given there were over 10 burritos to choose from). It was fine, I can see why the chocolate works as a nice sweet counter to the spice, but overall it was a bit plain. Chicken had no real flavour, the sauce was a bit weak, and the guacamole only came as a separate side, which is always annoying. I don't normally like jalapenos but here it was just nice to have some sourness coming through to counter the rest of the nice but fairly bland ingredients. It's possible given their range of options that one of them is really good, but I doubt this place will ever be top 10.

fields.name: Burrito Joe
fields.description: 1. Chicken Tinga - pretty good! Wrap lacked integrity and crispiness, but the avocado salsa was very nice, and the meat good enough to make it worthwhile. The level of spice was good, they make the correct call in choosing black beans as their default, and the coriander/lime flavours worked nicely. Would eat again.

fields.name: Cheeky Chicos
fields.description: 1. Chicken Tinga - was ok, but a bit plain. Rice might have been lime and coriander, and it did at least have black beans instead of kidney, but the salsa was on the side rather than in the burrito. I expected more flavour from the tinga, but saying that, I did have Coronavirus at the time so I might have lost my sense of taste
